title: Using more-specific 'genetic scissors' may avoid problems associated with gene editing

title_detail.value: Using more-specific 'genetic scissors' may avoid problems associated with gene editing

summary: A new study suggests that there could be a way to bypass barriers to making CRISPR gene-editing treatments a viable option. Researchers found that using more-precise gene-editing technology that induces fewer breaks in DNA may keep stem cells' natural damage-response pathways under control.
